newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends stronger, retains edge.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends stronger, retains edge.

text.p: A rise in call rates and dollar selling by state-owned banks helped the Bangladesh taka retain its early edge in interbank trading ahead of weekend, dealers said.

The taka finished at 44.1990/2010 against the previous close of 44.2100/2200. The local unit opened at 44.1950/2050 per dollar but deals mostly centred at around 44.2000 throughout the session, which saw liberal dollar selling by state-owned banks.

Call money was traded higher at 9.5 to 10 percent against 8.0-8.5 previously. Call rates rose after some banks paid about 1.35 billion taka against the purchase of central bank bills, auctioned on Wednesday.
